segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today we're back bringing you another great lesson, an intermediate lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们又回来了，给你带来另一节精彩的课程，中级课程。

segments.en: That's right, about one of my favorite subjects.
segments.cn: 没错，关于我最喜欢的主题之一。

segments.en: We're talking about food.
Exactly.
So on this occasion we're going to be talking about food.
segments.cn: 所以这次我们要谈论食物。

segments.en: So let's preview some words on vocabulary preview.
Alright, we have three words for you today.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们有三个词。

segments.en: And the first word is head chef.
Head chef.
Head chef.
So what is a head chef?
Well, in a professional kitchen, this is the boss of the kitchen, or the leader of the kitchen.
segments.cn: 在专业厨房中，这是厨房的老板，或厨房的领导。

segments.en: Okay, so the head chef is the main cook, so to say.
segments.cn: 好的，所以主厨是主要的厨师。

segments.en: Yes, but he doesn't cook.
But he doesn't cook.
Okay.
Alright, so if he doesn't cook, who's the one that does the cooking?
segments.cn: 好的，如果他不做饭，那谁来做呢？

segments.en: That brings us to our second word, sous chef.
segments.cn: 这就引出了我们的第二个词，副厨。

segments.en: Sous chef.
Sous chef.
Sous chef.
S-O-U-S.
So the S is silent because it's like a French word.
segments.cn: S是静音的，因为它像法语单词。

segments.en: Yeah, something like that.
Okay, so the sous chef is the second in line to the head chef.
segments.cn: 好的，所以副厨是主厨的第二把手。

segments.en: Yeah, he's the number two.
Number two.
So he's basically the one that's doing some of the work in the kitchen.
segments.cn: 所以他基本上是在厨房里做一些工作的那个人。

segments.en: Yeah.
Now let's take a look at our last word, cuisine.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看最后一个词，菜系。

segments.en: Cuisine.
Cuisine.
Cuisine.
So this is an interesting word.
What exactly does it mean?
Well, it basically means cooking, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，它基本上是指烹饪，对吧？

segments.en: Okay.
Like the art of cooking.
So for example, I can say French food.
segments.cn: 例如，我可以说法国食物。

segments.en: Yep, or French cuisine.
French cuisine, which includes all the food.
segments.cn: 法国菜系，包括所有的食物。

segments.en: Yep.
And this is also the major that people study in college to become a chef.
segments.cn: 这也是人们在大学学习的专业，以成为厨师。

segments.en: Yep.
They study cuisine.
And cuisine is a noun, right?
It's a noun.
Okay, so I think we're ready to dive into our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我想我们准备好进入对话了。

segments.en: What exactly is going on?
Well, we're in a restaurant, and it's a really busy night, and so we're going to listen to what is happening in the kitchen.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们在一家餐厅，今晚非常忙，所以我们要听听厨房里发生了什么。

segments.en: Right away, sir.
Your order will be ready shortly.
segments.cn: 您的订单很快就会准备好。

segments.en: Jean-Pierre, we have another special for table seven.
segments.cn: Jean-Pierre，我们有另一道特别菜要给七号桌。

segments.en: I'm working as fast as I can.
We are wheeling the weeds.
Where is my sous chef?
Look!
I need you to have more potatoes.
segments.cn: 我需要你多准备一些土豆。

segments.en: Marie, chop some onions and carrots for the stew.
segments.cn: Marie，切一些洋葱和胡萝卜做炖菜。

segments.en: Jean-Pierre, another special.
We're really packed tonight.
We're running low on wine.
Is there any left in the cellar?
Sorry I'm late, everyone.
Wow, we're really doing well tonight.
segments.cn: 哇，今晚我们真的做得很好。

segments.en: Hi.
Stop talking and get over here.
I need some sous-tit, and the fish needs to be butchered and buttered.
segments.cn: 我需要一些副厨，鱼需要被切割和涂黄油。

segments.en: Okay, I'm on it.
Jean-Pierre, table seven has requested to see the chef.
I think there are food critics from Cuisine Magazine.
segments.cn: 我想那里有《菜系杂志》的美食评论家。

segments.en: Okay, so a busy night here at this restaurant.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这家餐厅今晚很忙。

segments.en: I know, it sounds like there's a lot of pressure on this chef, Jean-Pierre.
segments.cn: 我知道，听起来这个厨师Jean-Pierre压力很大。

segments.en: Yeah, you can tell in his voice that he's really stressed out.
segments.cn: 是的，你可以从他的声音中听出他真的很紧张。

segments.en: Yeah.
Okay, let's take a look at some of this kitchen vocabulary that we found in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看我们在语言收获中找到的一些厨房词汇。

segments.en: Language Takeaway Alright, well we've got five words for you today.
segments.cn: 语言收获 好吧，今天我们有五个词。

segments.en: And the first one is peel.
Peel.
Peel.
Peel.
P-E-E-L.
So this is a verb, and it means to... Remove the outside skin.
segments.cn: 这是一个动词，意思是... 去掉外皮。

segments.en: Okay, so for example when you're gonna eat a banana... You must peel it first.
segments.cn: 好的，例如当你要吃香蕉时... 你必须先剥皮。

segments.en: You must peel it.
You gotta take away the yellow skin.
What else do you peel?
Oranges.
Potatoes.
Potatoes.
Like in the dialogue.
What else can you peel?
I don't know.
Carrots.
Carrots.
Yeah.
Some people peel their tomatoes.
I don't know why.
Yeah, it is kind of weird.
Alright, now let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们来看看下一个单词。

segments.en: Chop.
Chop.
Chop.
Chop.
So again, another verb, and it means to... It means to cut food into pieces.
segments.cn: 所以又是一个动词，意思是……意思是把食物切成块。

segments.en: So if you're gonna eat carrots, first you gotta chop them.
segments.cn: 所以如果你要吃胡萝卜，首先你得切它们。

segments.en: Exactly.
Right, you can't put a whole carrot in your soup or your rice.
segments.cn: 对，你不能把整根胡萝卜放进汤或米饭里。

segments.en: Okay, chop.
Okay, our next word, stirred.
Yeah, this is the past participle of the word stir.
segments.cn: 是的，这是动词搅拌的过去分词。

segments.en: Okay, so the verb stir.
Stir.
So when you stir something... Imagine you have a big pot, and you've got a long spoon.
segments.cn: 所以当你搅拌某样东西时……想象一下你有一个大锅，还有一根长勺子。

segments.en: You move the spoon around in circles, so you're stirring the pot.
segments.cn: 你把勺子在圆圈里转动，所以你在搅拌锅里的东西。

segments.en: You're mixing.
To stir is very similar to mix.
Yes.
Okay.
So you just move the food around.
segments.cn: 所以你只是把食物移动一下。

segments.en: Move the food around.
Okay, our next word, butchered.
Again, the past participle of the verb butcher.
segments.cn: 再次，动词屠宰的过去分词。

segments.en: Okay, butcher.
Butcher.
Now, this verb, to butcher something, it's when you remove all the bones and all the organs from the meat.
segments.cn: 现在，这个动词，屠宰某样东西，是指从肉中去除所有骨头和器官。

segments.en: Exactly, so you cut up the meat.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以你切割肉。

segments.en: And this is interesting because it's also a noun.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为它也是一个名词。

segments.en: Right, a butcher is a person who cuts up meat.
segments.cn: 对，屠夫是一个切割肉的人。

segments.en: Okay, so it's really easy.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这真的很简单。

segments.en: A butcher butchers meat.
Yes.
All right, our last word, butter.
segments.cn: 好吧，最后一个单词，黄油。

segments.en: Buttered.
Buttered.
Buttered.
Okay, so buttered, this is weird.
segments.cn: 好的，涂黄油，这有点奇怪。

segments.en: I know, normally we all know the noun butter, but here it's acting as a verb.
segments.cn: 我知道，通常我们都知道名词黄油，但在这里它作为动词使用。

segments.en: Okay.
So when you butter something, you spread or put butter on it.
segments.cn: 所以当你涂黄油时，你是在上面涂抹或放黄油。

segments.en: Simple.
Okay, so to put butter on something.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在某样东西上放黄油。

segments.en: So you can butter a piece of bread.
segments.cn: 所以你可以给一片面包涂黄油。

segments.en: Exactly.
Or in this case, the fish is being buttered.
segments.cn: 或者在这种情况下，鱼正在涂黄油。

segments.en: Sounds delicious.
Okay, now we're ready to listen to our dialogue for the second time.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们准备第二次听我们的对话。

segments.en: We're going to slow it down a little bit so it's easier to understand.
segments.cn: 我们会稍微放慢速度，这样更容易理解。

segments.en: Right away, sir.
Your order will be ready shortly.
segments.cn: 您的订单很快就会准备好。

segments.en: Jean-Pierre, we have another special for table seven.
segments.cn: 让-皮埃尔，我们有另一个特别菜要给七号桌。

segments.en: I'm working as fast as I can.
We are really in the weeds.
Where is my sous chef?
Look, I need you to peel more potatoes.
segments.cn: 听着，我需要你剥更多的土豆。

segments.en: Marie, chop some onions and carrots for the stew.
segments.cn: 玛丽，切一些洋葱和胡萝卜做炖菜。

segments.en: Jean-Pierre, another special.
segments.cn: 让-皮埃尔，另一个特别菜。

segments.en: We're really packed tonight.
We're running low on wine.
Is there any left in the cellar?
segments.cn: 地下酒窖还有剩下的吗？

segments.en: Whoa, sorry I'm late, everyone.
Wow, we are really doing well tonight.
segments.cn: 哇，今晚我们真的做得很好。

segments.en: Marie, stop talking and come over here.
I need the sous-teur and the fish needs to be butchered and buttered.
segments.cn: 我需要副厨，鱼需要被屠宰和涂黄油。

segments.en: Okay, I'm on it.
Jean-Pierre, table seven has requested to see the chef.
segments.cn: 让-皮埃尔，七号桌要求见厨师。

segments.en: I think they are food critics from Cuisine Magazine.
segments.cn: 我想他们是《美食杂志》的美食评论家。

segments.en: Okay, so that seems to be a little bit better.
And hey, I noticed that there's a lot of really great kitchen words in here, like words that you commonly hear in a professional kitchen.
segments.cn: 嘿，我注意到这里有很多很棒的厨房词汇，比如在专业厨房中常听到的词。

segments.en: Okay, so let's take a look at these kitchen words in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好的，所以让我们在流利构建器中看看这些厨房词汇。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
All right, we've got three phrases.
And the first one is in the weeds.
segments.cn: 第一个是“忙得不可开交”。

segments.en: In the weeds.
In the weeds.
In the weeds.
So when you're in the weeds, you're so, so busy and you can't do all the work you need to do on time.
segments.cn: 所以当你忙得不可开交时，你非常非常忙，无法按时完成所有工作。

segments.en: Okay, so in the weeds, it means that you're really busy.
segments.cn: 好的，所以“忙得不可开交”意味着你真的很忙。

segments.en: Yes.
And you can't finish everything.
segments.cn: 而且你无法完成所有事情。

segments.en: You can't, you have too much to do.
segments.cn: 你不能，你有太多事情要做。

segments.en: Yep.
Okay, in the weeds.
Okay, our next word, running low on.
segments.cn: 好的，下一个单词，快没了。

segments.en: Running low on.
Running low on.
Running low on.
Okay, so before we get into explaining what running low on means, let's listen to some examples.
segments.cn: 好的，在我们解释“快没了”是什么意思之前，让我们听一些例子。

segments.en: Example one.
You better look for a gas station.
We're running low on fuel.
Example two.
We're running low on beers.
Can you go out and get some?
Example three.
My flashlight is running low on battery.
segments.cn: 我的手电筒电池快没电了。

segments.en: Hurry up before it gets dark.
So basically, running low means... You don't have much of this left.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，快没了意味着……你剩下的不多。

segments.en: You don't have much of something left.
Yeah.
So here, they're running low on wine.
segments.cn: 所以这里，他们的酒快没了。

segments.en: So basically... There's not much wine left.
Right.
So as we heard in the examples, you could also be running low on fuel, for example, in your car, etc.
segments.cn: 所以正如我们在例子中听到的，你也可能在车里油快没了等等。

segments.en: Running low on.
All right, and now let's take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看最后一个词。

segments.en: Doing really well.
Doing really well.
We are doing really well.
Doing really well.
So this seems to be like a pretty simple structure.
segments.cn: 所以这似乎是一个相当简单的结构。

segments.en: I mean, we know all these words, right?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，我们知道所有这些词，对吧？

segments.en: So why is it special?
segments.cn: 那么它有什么特别之处？

segments.en: Well, basically, if you say, I am doing really well, maybe it sounds a little bit difficult to understand.
segments.cn: 嗯，基本上，如果你说，我过得很好，可能听起来有点难以理解。

segments.en: What are you doing really well?
So this is a great way of answering a question.
segments.cn: 所以这是回答问题的好方法。

segments.en: When somebody says, how are you?
Or how are you doing?
You can say, I'm doing really well.
Or I'm doing well.
In your life, everything is good.
segments.cn: 在你的生活中，一切都很好。

segments.en: In your life, things are good and you're happy, basically.
segments.cn: 在你的生活中，事情很好，你基本上很快乐。

segments.en: Yeah.
But in this situation, in the dialogue, what's doing really well?
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，在对话中，过得很好是什么？

segments.en: Well, the restaurant is doing really well.
The business is doing really well.
So when he says we're doing really well, business is good.
segments.cn: 所以当他说我们过得很好时，生意很好。

segments.en: They're making lots of money.
Exactly.
So you can use it with people.
segments.cn: 所以你可以用它来形容人。

segments.en: You can use it with businesses.
segments.cn: 你可以用它来形容企业。

segments.en: You can say, I'm doing really well in my new job.
segments.cn: 你可以说，我在新工作中过得很好。

segments.en: Yep.
Or my son is doing really well in school.
segments.cn: 或者我儿子在学校表现很好。

segments.en: Yep.
Okay.
So you can use it in those different ways.
segments.cn: 所以你可以用不同的方式来使用它。

segments.en: All right.
Well, let's listen to the dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们最后再听一次对话。

segments.en: And we'll be able to hear all of these great words and phrases we just talked about.
segments.cn: 我们将能够听到我们刚刚谈到的所有这些好词和短语。

segments.en: Right away, sir.
Your order will be ready shortly.
segments.cn: 您的订单很快就会准备好。

segments.en: Jean-Pierre, we have another special for table seven.
segments.cn: Jean-Pierre，我们有另一个特别的菜给七号桌。

segments.en: I'm working as fast as I can.
We are really in the weeds.
Where is my sous chef?
Look, I need you to peel my potatoes.
segments.cn: 看，我需要你来削我的土豆。

segments.en: Marie, chop some onions and carrots for the stew.
segments.cn: Marie，切一些洋葱和胡萝卜做炖菜。

segments.en: Jean-Pierre, another special.
We're really patched tonight.
We're running low on wine.
Is there any left in the cellar?
Sorry I'm late, everyone.
Wow.
We're really doing well tonight.
segments.cn: 我们今晚真的过得很好。

segments.en: Hi.
Stop talking and get over here.
I need some sauce and the fish needs to be butchered and buttered.
segments.cn: 我需要一些酱汁，鱼需要切块和涂黄油。

segments.en: Okay, I'm on it.
Jean -Pierre, table seven has requested to see the chef.
I think there are food critics from cuisine magazine.
segments.cn: 我想那里有《美食杂志》的美食评论家。

segments.en: So Marco, do you think this chef had a rat under his hat?
segments.cn: 所以Marco，你认为这个厨师的帽子下藏着一只老鼠吗？

segments.en: That was a really good movie.
segments.cn: 那是一部非常好的电影。

segments.en: Ratatouille at Disney Pixar, where a rat is a cook.
segments.cn: 《料理鼠王》在迪士尼皮克斯，讲述一只老鼠是厨师的故事。

segments.en: Yes.
It's interesting.
I love to cook, but I'm not very good at cooking.
segments.cn: 我喜欢做饭，但我做得不太好。

segments.en: But it's good because for me, it helps me relieve stress.
segments.cn: 但这很好，因为对我来说，它帮助我缓解压力。

segments.en: Me too, actually.
You know, if I'm in a bad mood, I go home and cook something to eat and the world seems a happier place.
segments.cn: 你知道，如果我心情不好，我回家做点吃的，世界似乎变得更快乐。

segments.en: And people don't understand it because they think cooking is work.
segments.cn: 而且人们不理解，因为他们认为做饭是工作。

segments.en: Yeah.
But, you know, for some people it's fun.
segments.cn: 但你知道，对某些人来说，这很有趣。

segments.en: So what about you guys?
What do you like to cook?
Do you have any particular dish that you prepare very well?
segments.cn: 你们有没有特别擅长的菜？

segments.en: And if you do, please send us the recipes.
segments.cn: 如果有，请把食谱发给我们。

segments.en: Exactly.
Because we know that we have listeners from all over the world.
segments.cn: 因为我们知道我们有来自世界各地的听众。

segments.en: And of course, we want to know what type of food you prefer.
segments.cn: 当然，我们想知道你们喜欢什么类型的食物。

segments.en: So come to EnglishPod.com and post your questions, your comments and your recipes in our community section.
segments.cn: 所以请访问EnglishPod.com，在我们的社区部分发布你的问题、评论和食谱。

segments.en: And Erika and I will always be there.
Yes.
To test out your recipes as well as answer questions.
segments.cn: 来测试你的食谱以及回答问题。

segments.en: For sure.
If a good recipe comes along, we'll prepare it and we'll let you know how it turned out.
segments.cn: 如果有好的食谱，我们会准备它，并告诉你结果如何。

segments.en: All right, guys, we're out of time, but we'll see you next time.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我们没时间了，但下次见。

segments.en: Until then, goodbye.
